column4: Could someone tell me how to log in as root on ubuntu server?
event not found jrib
please read what ubottu said
don't do what RichiH has suggested as it is unecessary
ifconfig gives you your ip
my account on the server is already root so i just use sudo now
add him to the "admin" group
writing files where?
do you know about sudo?
so what are you running exactly?
I am trying to make my second monitor work, as for some reason it's configuration is set to "Disabled" when i try to save my Configuration file, it won't let me write
again, where are you doing this exactly?
System>Preferences>Display
so you are never prompted for your password?

it's probably a bug.  I've never used that feature so I don't know.  Setting a root password isn't necessary or recommonded and won't fix the issue.  You could try running that app with sudo.  Find out its name then run gksudo name_of_app
how do i find out what the app is called?
right click on the ubuntu icon -> edit menu
the name of the app is just display
I meant the command for it
i did gksudo display
I mean, it's probably not display
gnome-display-properties
gnome-display-properties, yes
Thank you for your help. Much appreciated
